CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 20, 1954, pg. 6 reads: "Spokesmen For Blind - The grievances of telephone salesmen of the Pennsylvania Association for the Blind, who were unable to get adequate supplies of products to sell, prompt delivery on sales, and who had to face cut-throat competition from club groups making sales in their districts, was laid on the line along with the gripes of production workers who, for the past two weeks, have been on strike at a public hearing Monday in Council Chambers. Among the spokesmen for the salesmen were William Corey, left, and Maurice Taylor, right.  Mrs. Taylor is between them. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: William Corey, Mrs. Taylor wearing beret, and Maurice Taylor, seated on bench in Pittsburgh City Council Chambers at the City County Building
